actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill to provide that recent amendments of section 1239 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 shall not apply to a disposition of property if a private letter ruling, issued before the enactment of the amendments, provided that such section would not apply to the disposition.

summary.text: Amends the Installment Sales Revision Act of 1980 to provide that gain from the sale of depreciable property between certain related taxpayers shall not be treated as ordinary income if a private letter ruling issued by the Internal Revenue Service before such Act would not require such treatment.

titles.title: A bill to provide that recent amendments of section 1239 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 shall not apply to a disposition of property if a private letter ruling, issued before the enactment of the amendments, provided that such section would not apply to the disposition.
